Summary: We enjoyed our stay here. Although we only stayed for one night, we enjoyed the conveniences: close to beach, quiet rooms, A/C, beach toys/chairs/boogie boards, and free parking. Carrie was great to work with! Everything close within walking distance too.

Great location - nice place for 2 - very clean and quiet - staff very helpful - has AC which most AirBnBs in the area do not - chairs and bogie boards for the beach - frig and freezer and onsite parking

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location, friendly and helpful staff
Summary: I came here with my daughter for 3 days and this is the perfect place for us to stay! It's more than reasonably priced for the location and you have FREE parking! Clean, safe, and everyone here is so friendly. Keri will do her best to accommodate any requests you may have. We felt very comfortable here and it's so easy to get to the beach, pier or Main Street. The rooms are a little 1960's Route 66 retro, but the bathrooms are updated and you have a microwave and refrigerator.

You get what you pay for...it is clean but very small and it does not have ocean front views. The shower had good pressure you just can't turn around in it. It food for 2 people just not a family. Will not go back.

Great and reliable staff!  Found my sons lost iPad from 1.5 years ago. It was left on a plane. I locked it with a message to call me if it was found and a housekeeper found it, gave to manager and she called!  We now have it back. Thank you. There are still great people in this world.

They let us check in early and free parking. The hotel was reasonably priced. Could see the ocean from our window. The room was clean and just what we needed for one night. Had a fridge in the room but no microwave or coffee maker. Walk across the street and you are at the beach. Easy walk to the shops, restaurants and the pier.

Extremely satisfied customers! Cozy room, very clean, great customer service, perfect walking distance to the beach, shopping area & restaurants. We stayed for two nights this trip, we would stay here again in a heartbeat. Highly recommend!!

Summary Heading: Terrific Old-School Motel at the beach in Huntington Beach
Summary: I stayed at this hotel 3 times while working in Long Beach in January and February 2020, and I got terrific off-season rates.  I stayed in a small/1-person upstairs room and "the big room" (#18) upstairs from Reception (twice).  Both rooms were spotless, decorated with a surfer theme, and had a small fridge and microwave (if you're staying in a smaller room, you have to ask for the room with the microwave).  The location is amazing--literally right across the street from the ocean and a wide sand beach; about 1/2 mile north of the Pier and Main Street, which is full of good surf (apparel)  shops and restaurants. Free on-site parking and beach chairs available for guests.  Running/walking/biking path right across the street that goes miles in each direction along the ocean front.
Room tip: The big room (#18) has a whole wall ocean view, 2 big beds and a pull-out couch

Summary: Travelled to HB to see my son play in a tourney and wanted to stay beachside. Since it was valentine's weekend all the hotels were quite pricey. Found this gem and was very impressed!! Great location, can walk everywhere! Splurged for a beach view too! Very clean too. Karrie in the front office was great. We arrived early and were able to check in (she had advised me prior that if the room was ready we would be able to check in & if not we could at least park for free). Will defintely stay here again!! Cutest beachy vibe!!

We were supposed to be going to a Musical Festival which got cancelled.  Made the best of it for our first time in HB.  Location is great and the room was very comfortable.  Carrie made our stay fantastic!   Direct access to the beach but the crosswalk needs to be labeled better, possibly with a light.  Beach is beautiful and we enjoyed our stay very much.  Rooms was clean and covered all our needs.
Room tip: very quaint and small. Beach access is great

Summary: Real atmospheric old school hotel ( motel). Free parking directly opposite the beach. This place is no frills but the room is very clean, the bed very comfortable and the shower room clean and basic, good hot shower. The WiFi is poor. We used this place as a base just to sleep for 2 nights and we are more than satisfied. It’s around 10 minute walk to town. For us it was perfect it you are looking for something a little less basic, to unpack your suit case or spend time in the room go somewhere else, if just for a base stay here. Very good value for money

Sun n Sands never disappoints, such a quaint spot across the street from the water. Carrie and staff were so sweet and kind. Kimo the cat made sure to greet you each morning. It’s all you need for a lazy trip to Huntington. See you soon!

The best thing about this place is the location. It's across the street from the beach and you can easily walk to Main St. and the pier. We stayed in room #2 and it was not good. I have a pretty high tolerance for hotel rooms, I don't need things to be fancy, but the room smelled musty/moldy and the "air conditioner" was a cheap thing mounted to the wall that barely worked and automatically shut off after about 15 minutes. It would have been more effective to just have a fan in the room. We had to leave the windows open, which resulted in hearing late night conversations and some great guy smoking his cigar right outside our window. I wish the room was decent, because I really like motels, but I won't be staying at this place again.

So what I love about our 4 day stay over 4th of July is the nostalgia.  60 years this hotel has been here! The price is great considering the location is directly across PCH from the sand. You can cross the street at 11th and PCH or walk a few blocks to the traffic light. We enjoyed the fireworks right out front on the lawn of the hotel.  The manager checking us in and out was really friendly.  The room was ok but hey it's an old school hotel.  They give you coffee and a wrapped "cookie" snack each morning but they really could invest in a better coffee maker as it wasn't very hot. They should do better with the snack, maybe get a local bakery or donut shop?? The shower head is really short and wasn't good for my tall husband.  No soap dish by bathroom sink which made for a mess

I was shocked by how reasonable the prices were for a place so close to the water; I fully expected it to be sub par but was so surprised! The view is amazing! Your a quick 3 minute walk to Main Street and literally across the street from the beach! The rooms were clean and comfy! Parking was easy and safe! The front desk was so sweet! If your coming to Huntington I’d say look into this place for sure!!

I stayed here for four nights. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The room was clean but a bit out dated but for the price, and location it was well worth it. The beach is directly across the street. Lots of shopping, restaurants, bars and entertainment is within walking distance. Great street fair on Tuesday nights on Main St.

Stayed here for 1 night. Has convenient parking right outside your room. A short 8 minute walk to Main street in Huntington Beach. Rooms are large, clean and comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff. Would recommend.

I am always a fan of nice White noise, Rivers, or waves. Well this hotel has plenty of surf right outside the hotel. The shudders open wide and the constant sea noise is always present. The room was perfect, bed was comfortable and they had turn down service at night. 1st class all the way. Bar and restaurant on site was amazing.      You won't be disappointed as long as you can sleep through the white noise of waves rolling up on a sandy beach.

The manager went out of her way to supply us with all the items we needed for the beach. The staff was friendly and helpful.  It was very clean and the location is amazing.  It's not fancy so if you're looking for all the frills this isn't your place.  They have a room with a queen, a king and a pull out so our entire family fit.  We will be back!

Very nice motel, with a friendly staff. The location is perfect for Huntington Beach, close enough to the pier and Main Street but far enough to escape the crowds. Room was very accommodating with an updated shower. I was most impressed how well maintained everything was and especially the room. I will be returning soon.

This will be the second time we are staying here. My husband and I stayed here last year for our anniversary, and this may become a tradition! I absolutely LOVE this place! It's very "Old School"! EXTREMELY well kept, clean, and right across the street from the beach! That is a plus for me! Last year we could see the ocean from our room, even though it was not technically an oceanview, but this year we have an oceanview. There are two floors only, so I recommend the top floor, better views. It's pricey, but to me, worth every penny! They sell out quickly, especially in summer, so if you find it available, book it, you won't be sorry. The woman at the front desk, I'm assuming the owner, is so nice! She let us leave our car parked there the day we checked out, do we could walk

I rated this hotel a 5 because of location. The hotel is nothing special but you can walk to the beach and to Huntington to eat and hang out. This was a perfect place for me and my grown kids to hang out for a couple days!!

Summary Heading: Terrific stay in a great location
Summary: Nice clean hotel with a friendly staff. This is a great location if you want to discover the restaurants, clothing shops, beach, and downtown Huntington Beach. We would definitely return. Thanks, Carrie, for a wonderful stay.

We loved our stay here.  We rented 3 rooms with 2 of the rooms connecting. Prices are so reasonable. The motel is a little dated but it added to the quaintness of it. The rooms where very clean and the lady at the front desk was so friendly.  We needed to check in early because our flight got in super early and she was so accommodating and helpful.  Its in an ideal location.  Right across PCH from the beach and about a 5-10 min walk to the pier and restaurants and great shopping.  We will definitely staying there again.

We did a West coast drive from SF down to Huntington Beach,Staying at the Sun n Sands ,We were a little worried as this was one of the cheaper beach front Inns, but we had nothing to worry about,we had very clean,reasonably comfortable rooms facing the fab beach across the road and only 5 mins walk from pier.The lady at the reception (Karrie I think ?) was great,nothing too much trouble,coffee and pastries in the morning,towels and toys to use on beach etc. Great value for money and thoroughly enjoyed our stay 😀

Clean basic room in an ideal location, easy walk to the pier, beach and downtown. Lots of decent eating places close by. The room included a fridge. Coffee was available from reception in the mornings along with pastries.  Parking was free. Only downside is that the Wi-Fi was slow and our room door would not lock, however they said they will look into this straight away.

Clean basic room with off-street parking included and location, location, location!! Yes, it's a bit pricey for a motel, but it's across PCH from the beach and it's walking distance to the pier and downtown. We came to spend 4th of July at the beach and weren't disappointed. Parade, fireworks, people, parties and one of the best beaches in Southern California right outside our door!

Summary Heading: Clean and in a great location
Summary: I loved this place. We stayed for 3 nights. The location was great, about 4 blocks from the pier and right across the street from the beach. We stepped out of our room and had a great view of the Pacific. The room as clean and had everything we needed, including a mini fridge. It wasn't fancy, but it got the job done and the price was fairly reasonable considering the location. The lady at the front desk was very friendly. I would stay here again.

Stayed for 2 evenings on a Californian road trip. Location is right on the beach, the room was tidy and clean, bathroom was good. Location is about a 5 min walk from the main area and shops.  The person running the motel was very friendly and helpful - we were able to borrow chairs, beach towels and beach umbrella.  Would definitely recommend for anyone looking to stay in Huntingdon beach

Summary Heading: Your Basics; Beach and a Bed
Summary: This hotel is perfect for people who just want to be near the beach and don’t care too much about the amenities.   Price:   This was the cheapest hotel that I found along a whole host of hotels along the PCH Huntington Beach Strip. That price does fluctuate with availability (My trip was in April) but it still will be the lowest cost or one of the lowest cost hotels in the area.  If you want more of a resort atmosphere there are a few really nice resort hotels just south but they cost a little more.  Amenities:    This hotel is bare bones which was perfect for me because I was out most of the day on the beach or traveling around town so I only needed a bed, a shower and a refrigerator. The fridge is sizeable and can handle a bunch of sandwiches and beverages.  There is also a

This is a wonderful old school type motel.  The employees all take pride in maintaining it and both my wife & myself were really happy that we stayed with them.  The room and especially the bath room were very clean (and that means a lot to us).  Bed was comfortable and at the window was a sitting area to view the sunset and have a snack + a drink or two.  Parking was a breeze(no charge), and I thought the room rate was exceptional.  Plus, you are right across the street from the Beach!  Walking distance to downtown and the pier was a few blocks, but manageable.  We will be "booking" here again, when we stay in this area, for sure.  Give it a try and you will be convinced too!

Summary Heading: Nice little motel right on PCH, steps from the beach!
Summary: We booked this motel because we wanted to be close to the water and pier. It is an easy walk to both. The rooms are small but comfortable. Linens nice, king bed comfy. The hotel was very clean. The woman at the desk was very helpful to us. Highly recommend staying here.....but don't book on a hotel booking site....call them directly!

Nice place!   Only what we needed & nothing else!   Great location, right across PCH from the beach.  With all the traffic on PCH you'd think it'd be noisy but it wasn't!  We'd stay there again as we have family in the area.

This location is located right down the street from the beach very nice staff the lady working at the front desk has some candy located right behind the front counter go ahead and purchase it's quite affordable as for the rooms there beautiful I suggest getting a non smoking upstairs please enjoy your stay at this location

Sun n sands motel offers easy access to the beach and a easy walk to the boardwalk and downtown. Downtown is very lively on weekends and Tuesday night farmers market. This is the first farmers market I have been to with multiple live music acts playing at once. Back to the motel, rooms are small for 4 people but manageable. Bedding is terrible. Matteresses are worn and uncomfortable. Owner if you read reviews, please replace. Overall room cleanliness is a 6. Desk help extremely helpful and offers a good California vibe.

This place is right on PCH, about 1/2 mile north of Huntington Beach pier. It is surprisingly quiet for being in a corner and property is small. I think there are 18 rooms or so. No pool or other amenities but the beach is 2 minutes walk! The first night we stayed in a two-queen bed room. It was tight for 5 of us (parents/kids), but the next night we stayed in the family suite. It was perfect! King bed, pull out couch, and full size bunk beds. Lots of room, and looks out over PCH and Pacific Ocean! Beautiful!  Older motel, but clean and very friendly staff.  The manager, Carrie, was helpful and friendly. She let my mom park in the motel parking lot, as she came to visit just for the day.  Would love to stay in that suite again! (The pic of palm trees was taken from our room

This place was great, simple and all you need. Ac, refrigerator, microwave, great shower, free parking. Walking distance to the water, great location, chill vibe, accessible to everything. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rad!

Summary Heading: Relaxing week at the beach with no real plans
Summary: We just got home from spending a week here. It was so amazing to be able to walk across the street and be at the beach. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very quaint and beach themed. We are already talking about a trip back. Thank you Carrie for a great week.
Manager Response: you are very much welcome. hope to see you again..... carrie

Summary: While staying in Las Vegas we decided to spend our last 2 days of vacation in Huntington Beach. This motels location is unbelievably incredible! What they lack in resort amenities they more than make up for in price, location and friendliness. It is less than a 1 minute walk to the gorgeous beach and within 3-8 minute walk from shopping and restaurants. The rooms are cozy, beds are comfy, AC is very quiet, they lack outlets but that wasn't a huge deal, they don't have hair dryers in the rooms but if you go to the office and ask they will be more than happy to hand you one. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay... carrie

Summary: Had friends from out of town visiting and decided to go to the beach and needed a place to stay. Found this and a lucky find it was. It's old BUT clean, well run, friendly and easily within walking distance to the beach. They allowed us leave our car after check out so no additional parking fees were paid. We left the Kindle under the pillow, they were quick to call us so we could come back and pick it up. A huge thank you for that!

Summary Heading: A basic clean room with a great location
Summary: This is your basic motel, a clean room with thin walls, but right across from the beach and walking distance to downtown. My wife and I came with our 6 year old, and I was very surprised to find out the front desk has a number of beach toys for kids to take with them, also beach towels for everyone. The lady at the front desk was super nice. We walked everywhere, beach, dinner, breakfast and shopping and never had to drive anywhere. A little pricey but your paying for location.

Stayed in room 3. It's not the Hilton but it's quaint and it's clean. Directly across from the beach and 8 minute walk to Pier and all the shopping. You can't beat this place. Lady who runs the motel is so accommodating. She goes out of her way to help you. Will Definitely Stay here if I ever go back again.

My husband and I stayed here over Memorial Weekend.  It's a typical beach motel, which is exactly what I wanted.  I knew we would be at the beach most of the time so I didn't want anything fancy or too expensive.  It was a bit expensive for such a ordinary motel room but hey, it's right at the beach.  We parked our car upon arriving and didn't get in the car again until we left.  It's close enough to walk to the beach and to the pier and the downtown section of Huntington Beach so it was quite handy.  The room was a little small but it was clean and even a bit homey.  The office has coffee in the morning so I would go get a cup o joe and sit at the tables outside and drink my coffee looking at the ocean.  We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: An average motel in the best location!
Summary: I stayed for 5 nights here in August of 2007. I was younger then but i still remeber some of the details to this day. The hotel rooms were average and there were not that many rooms. There was also a lot of noise at the property next door. The hotel is located across PCH from the beach and is in the best spot in Huntington Beach!

I usually skip by small motels, because I have always had bad experiences with them. They are always dirty and run down, this was a really nice motel, with a beautiful ocean view and a short walk to the ocean. The lady at the front desk was accommodating and very sweet. Loved the stay and will stay again.

The motel is clean and well kept. Ample parking and no drive through traffic is allowed. The front desk is helpful and friendly with discount coupons, brochures and local knowledge and advice.  The room itself is on a par with Super 8 accommodations, which is a cut above Motel 6. Furnishing and bedding are designed to endure ocassional sand, though a courtyard hose is provided for foot and leg rinse off before entering your room. The plumbing was in good condition and there was both central air and an overhead fan. Neither interfered with sleep. If you are not used to it, the traffic noise from Pacific Coast Highway is noticeable. If it is a concern, take a Benedryl and sleep through the night undisturbed. Too, like all motels, the walls always seem thinner than they are at

the family and i had a great time staying there. staff was very friendly and everything is located very close by. we plan on returning soon. would recommend to anyone. a beautiful sunrise and sunset! The view from our room window was looking across the street right onto the beach and ocean. It was fantastic!

This is by no means a 5-star hotel, but if you are looking for a room with a shower, comfortable bed, television, and an ocean right across the street, then this is your motel.  The staff was very helpful and polite.  The cleaning lady was also very nice and did a great job each of the four days that we were there.  Oh, and the rooms do have brand new A/C units that are very quiet and efficient. The ocean is literally right across the street and can be seen from the balcony of your room if you are staying on the second floor.  We didn't use our car at all during the week because literally everything is within walking distance; CVS, bars, restaurants, bike rentals, the beach, etc. Sure, the room could use some updating, but you're in Huntingdon to go to the beach and enjoy the

We have stayed several times over the last year while visiting our son.  It may be an older motel but it is very clean and comfortable.  Carrie and her staff are very accommodating and friendly.  We park at the motel and never use a car once we are there.  Everything is within walking distance and its very easy to get food delivered from all the great restaurants nearby.  Just a short walk across the street and you are on the beach.  They have worked really hard re-decorating and installing new heating and air conditioning.  The air conditioner is super quiet for a great nights sleep.

This motel is very old, old carpets, noisy, poor sleep quality.  Good for young kids on a party or surfers staying here on a budget.  Staff unfriendly. If you are on a low budget still would not stay here.

Situated directly on PCH with the stunning sands of Huntington Beach just steps away, this place is a throw back to the 60's.  No frills, just nice, sparse rooms, all with ocean views. Clean and convenient, just 4 blocks to Main Street and Huntington Beach Pier, the place is well maintained with on site parking.  Morning coffee and sweets are complimentary.

Great little place to stay if you like the beach and the beach is right across the street. Good restaurants nearby. Had a great time bodysurfing for the first time in 43 years. Wish we would of had more time to hang there. I definitely will go back.

We stayed 2 nights in 2 rooms.  The location was perfect and the rooms had all we really needed for a beach stay.  Nothing fancy but nice hot showers and comfortable rooms.  Only thing we didn't like was the carpet was a bit dirty and got our feet dirty.  Great customer service and good deal!

As other reviews point out, this hotel is a bit dated, but I found it to be clean and in a great location.  The staff was super friendly.  Being walking distance to downtown was what really made this a great, convenient place to stay.  I'm a former HB resident who now lives in Denver, and make trips out to HB to visit my grown daughter.  She recently moved to downtown, and it turns out is only 2 blocks from this hotel.  So, not only was the Main Street area within a short walk, so was she!  I barely had to take my car anywhere, we just walked!  The only comment I have is the bed is a bit too firm for my liking, and the pillows a bit too flat.  But, I really didn't have any issues as by the time I hit the sack, I was pretty tired from the walking and time in the sun!  Price is

This motel is nothing fancy and it is outdated, but it doesn't try to be more than that. I enjoy staying here because it reminds me of old Huntington before everything turned into a multi million dollar mansion and it was an affordable, laid back surf town with friendly people. The staff couldn't be more helpful or friendly. This is the place to stay if you you want to spend your day on the beach and then come back to take a hot shower and pass out. It is priced high for what it is, but if you look at all the other HB hotels, you will see it is on par for your money and you can't beat the location. There is no air conditioning, so having your door open is standard during the hot summer months. This often leads to getting to know your neighbors. If you don't want to hear or see
Manager Response: so glad you enjoyed your stay. i wish i would have known that you did not see the remote for the air conditioning unit. we do have AC!!!! hope to see you again. much mahalos, carrie

Summary: It's a dump. The price isn't worth for what you get. But it has a nice location to the beach and they have great farmers market Fridays i guess not sure, very close to this overpriced motel of very vad quality..  ...... ................. ........... .... .... ..... ..... ........ ......

Summary Heading: Get what you pay for, but does need an upgrade
Summary: Overall we were very happy with the location, price an staff, everything was within walking distance so we didn't need to hire a car, there was a couple of issues with the room on check in, but the manager was straight onto getting them addressed and by the time we returned from looking around it had been fixed, We will be staying again an bringing the car and dog next time as we found it to be 1 of the very few pet friendly motels left in our wonderful country :) we look forward to rebooking in november 2014 with them and would recommend it to anyone with a pet looking for for somewhere well priced to stay.

Was down for the Surf City Marathon and wanted to get close to the start line.  Hyatt was charging more than $440 a night.  Surf 'n' Sands was still a bit pricey for a "Motel" at almost $200 a night, but i figured why not give it a try.  Bad idea. The place was disgusting.  The best thing i can say about it is a great location, 1/2 mile from downtown.  That's it.  The furniture is ancient, the bed covers have cigarette burns in them.  There is some kind of mold situation going on in the bathroom.  Light doesn't work in room.  Remote doesn't work in room.  TV from 1989.  Nothing has been updated in 50 years. Moreover, I have serious safety concerns.  Electrical tape around lamp cords, multiple cords going into an outlet designed for two.  Oh it was also real pleasant having guys
Manager Response: i am seriously very sorry for your worst experience ever.  when you made your reservation the day before the surf city marathon, i did tell you that we had a 2 day minimum. i had a smoking room with 2 queen beds with an ocean view that is available for 1 night only. the rate $189.00. the other non smoking room with 1 queen bed has a 2 night minimum.  this room had no view and is very standard sized handicap room. rate $189.00 each night. you did tell me that the hyatt is $440.00 with no 2 night minimum. the afternoon of your free late check out we spoke for about 10 minutes. i had no idea that your stay was this unpleasant. i did apologize about the 2 men refurbishing the sign board. i did speak about the furniture to you because i told you that in 2 weeks a delivery of new furniture will be here. i was excited about it. we are a 55 year old motel. maintenance never ends. still that is no excuse for dirty. there is no mold on the rubber runner to the handicap shower. the paint has worn off in places. i had it painted, the electrical cord repaired, and ceiling fan dusted the same day of this review. the ceiling fan blades need to be changed. they are frayed at the ends. not dusty. i was sad to read that you felt this place should be torn down. working here for 10 years i have learned that we can't please everyone. but we do please most and have numerous repeat guests. i would invite you to stay again, but believe you would think i am crazy for asking. thank you for your review....

Summary: Not the newest or shiniest but superb value and located right on the beach.  Pet friendly, the huntington dog beach is a lovely 3 block walk down the beach.  3 blocks the other way is downtown Huntington for food and surf shops.

My wife and I stayed here for the weekend it was clean,quiet, & the manager was very friendly. The view of the ocean was beautiful at sunset from the balcony. The location was very convenient we walked to the Huntington pier and shops in less than five minutes. Plenty of restaurants,bars,and clothing stores within walking distance we had a great time and are looking forward to returning next year

The Sun 'n' Sands Motel is conveniently located across the street from the beach and within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. The noise from the highway (and other guests) could be bothersome for some travellers (I travel with earplugs). The lady at the front desk was friendly and helpful, and we liked the resident kitties. As for the room, it was a basic room (with a comfortable bed) but the motel is well maintained (wifi was weak though). We appreciated the fresh coffee and little pastries in the morning. The downside was a musty smell in the room, but all in all it was a good stay.

If you are in search for a luxury hotel, move right along, this is not it. However, if you are looking for a clean, basic motel with a friendly service and free car parking, on the beach-front, within walking distance from the pier and all the shops and restaurants - look no further. I would stay here again. It was cute. :-)

Summary Heading: Spot on for our needs - it is what it is!
Summary: Well we had a great time at this property. Those of you who have tried will know that getting reasonably priced accommodation near the beach, near the centre of Huntington Beach, (Or Newport beach for that matter) particularly on the Pacific Coast Highway itself is impossible!  Therefore the Sun n Sands motel is ideal. If you are looking for a luxury hotel please look elsewhere! However, if you are on a road trip and are looking for somewhere in a ideal location, with access to the beach across the road and Huntington pier and restaurants a short walk away, a place to rest your head with a clean bed and shower then look no further. Carrie was very helpful and there was free wifi and free coffee in the morning, what more do you need?

We seen reviews and thought it could be old but as long as its clean it would be okay for a night or two. What a dirty dump they advertised for $129 per night, we ended up being charged for $179 night, it was worth $29.00 at the most . It Is indeed across from the ocean but pretty much everything is in HB within walking distance.  I'm not picky as long as its clean, unfortunately the room was dirty & gross, I pulled off the bedspread and the mattress cover had blood stains, the pillows resembled pancakes, the chairs were dirty I don't think they've e been wiped down, the AC was two old fans one that was broken, the TV from the 1977 didn't work the bed was like a inside out hammock in fact our truck was looking more appealing by the minute, we were in room 9 noisy hot and smelly

Yes, this place is across the street from the water, BUT, the rooms smell & have run down old furniture. NO air conditioning....We were offered a couple different rooms but were able to get a refund & cancel our reservation on the day of check in.

I love this motel...it is right across from the beach and and 8 minute walk to the pier and down town. The gal at the desk couldnt have been nicer. The rooms were quaint and beachy and very clean.This is the best value in HB. Will definitely stay again and again.

Small motel directly across from beach, had the end unit with a great view of the ocean.  Large room with king, full size bunks in an alcove and a pull out couch could be shared by a family.  Quiet area, friendly owner.  Ticky Tacky but that's part of the charm.

Summary Heading: If you want close the beach and something reasonable, stay here!
Summary: It's very difficult to find something reasonable in Huntington Beach that is close to the beach. Cross the street and your on the beach, a few minute walk to the pier. The owner was very friendly and accommodating. We called the place at 11:30 am, asked how soon they could get us in, they got us in our room at 12. The room was definitely a outdated but was clean, and for the price and location in Huntington Beach... can't beat it.

What's good: It's right across from that beautiful beach, and it's near the pier. There's a little table with chairs for a simple meal, plus fridge and microwave. It's cheap, for Huntington Beach.  What's not: Of all the places we stayed on this trip to California and Las Vegas, this was our least favourite.  It certainly wasn't the cheapest.  The bathroom is very cramped and you have to ask for a hair dryer. The wifi only works if you walk over to the tacky little office. The decor is dated and the bedding smelled musty and slightly smoky. "Breakfast" was coffee with powdered creamer, and a choice of cookies that looked like fig newtons or cream filled sugar sandwiches. Nothing nutritious there.  Some people arrived at midnight and talked loudly right outside our window

My wife and I have really enjoyed our stay at this motel. The staff were always ready and willing to assist us with any questions or concerns, and when your from out of town you really feel welcome. This quaint motel offers  great location,really good service and at a reasonable price.

Summary Heading: Best Service I Have Ever Recieved
Summary: This place was a 3 minute walk to the water. The lady at the front desk gave our children buckets and shovels for the sand, our room had a microwave and they had food right in the office everything was reasonably priced they had surfboards and boogie boards for rent at 1/4th the price at zachs the local board rental shop They had our room reserved the night after we stayed there so we had to move to a diffrent room the second day. She moved our stuff for us all we had to do was pack up. I would give this motel a 8 out of ten only because they didnt have A/C It was nice out but when you close the window and curtain it got hot fast. although it was easily remedeed with one of the two fans they provide all we did was open the door and put the fan on the door frame and the room was

If you are looking for a fancy hotel room with a lot of ammenities, this is probably not the best option for you! The rooms are good size and clean.  It is an older motel, there is no air conditioning and you have an actual key for the door.  The location is AMAZING.  You can walk to the beach which is across the street (literally) and to Main st (just a few blocks away).  They have free internet and there is a refridgerator in the room.  Make sure to have a quarter for the ice machine as it isn't free.  No coffee maker but there are plenty of coffee shops on Main st.

Summary Heading: Good location - Decent room for the price
Summary: Nothing fancy but a good room for the price - found the front desk to be helpful. We would stay here again if we were visiting Huntington Beach.

Summary Heading: Good location, but a bit run-down
Summary: Huntington Beach is a wonderful location and a brilliant place to spend some time if you love the sea (and surfing). This motel is located only a short walk from the pier and the central shopping plaza.  In this case it really is a matter of getting what you sign up for. They are not posing as a luxury resort and it certainly isn't. Our room was clean and relatively comfortable. I would not recommend this for a family holiday or extended stay, but then that isn't what you would expect from a motel!  I did think it was a bit pricey, but since we only stayed one night, the convenience of being centrally located was worth it. The decor is dated, but they provided free internet and there are many great restaurants and bars just around the corner.

Summary Heading: Fair rate, good room, walking distance from the pier. That's all you need!
Summary: My wife and I had no reservations at all but everything worked out fine during our short stay in Huntington Beach. We checked several other hotels/motels in the area, some of them way inland, but decided to stay at Sun 'n' Sands because of the fair rate considering the excellent location. Friendly staff, safe, quiet, walking distance from the pier and you just have to cross PCH in order to have your feet buried in the sand. That's all you're looking for when you stay in HB, right?

The Sun and Sands was recommended to me by a friend.   After going online and reading some of review I debated about going.  I am so glad I went!  The lady at the front was amazing.  I have a 8, 6 and 3 year old and they all loved her.  She was extremely friendly and helpful.

This little motel is not a pretentious hotel but gee, it does the job. The on site manager, Carrie, works hard to please and accommodate her guests. We checked in for two nights, have ended up staying four, and would stay longer if we did not have to fly home. The mini suite we had...slightly larger than your normal double room, was clean and spacious. The rooms were serviced daily was a lovely cleaning lady. As for safety, I don't know what that whacko below was talking about, but we were comfortable enough to leave the teens to themselves for an hour while we had a quick romantic dinner at Main Street. Plenty of Jag's, Lexus's, and Mercedes in the car park, so they must have felt good about the  place too. You can't beat location as it's right across the road from Huntington

Summary Heading: I will always want to go back to Huntington Beach
Summary: It was our second time there. We were visiting Los Angeles, and I talked my friends into going down there. We didn`t have a reservation, just showed up, but we got our rooms just fine. For a motel it has all the equipment you need. The rooms are a bit tight but you`re not spending much time in there so its fine. Nice bathroom with a shower. They have their own parking lot, so thats a plus. Main street is just a few minutes walk, so you are close to everything!

Summary Heading: Cheap close but not worth the price!
Summary: First stay there was hair on the pillows they did give us new pillows in plastic.  Second stay the shower didn't work&  they were we will fix it soon. Hours later then coped an attitude.
The Hotel has the best location in the United States of America if you don't count Hawaii

We had our most horrible hotel-motel experience in our life in this place. The lady at the front desk had an attitude from the moment we walked in. The non-smoking room we got have been heavily smoked in, the rooms were dirty and roach-infested. Will never go back even at gunpoint.

Summary Heading: You're paying for location--and that's it
Summary: It is a gorgeous spot right across from the beach, but rooms are small and worn, there is NO A/C (I missed that in other reviews) and even our ceiling fan didn't work well. Paper thin walls mean it's a gamble if you have kids or want to sleep-- we were lucky, but still could hear partying until midnight or so. We paid 187 dollars for one night-- not sure it was worth it for a quick walk on the beach. Just know what you're getting into-- if you want to be close to the beach, this might be a good option, but it is a run down motel.

Summary Heading: you get what you pay for- not for family
Summary: we read the review in sunset magazine and figured it was worth a shot. the location is great but you get what you pay for. the walls are paper thin and we heard everything that happened in neighboring rooms. We figured if it was in sunset it would be family friend...not so much! One neighbor was up partying until 5 am and you could hear every word the teenagers said. By 5 am we figured it wasn't stopping. my husband went next door to get them to leave only to be yelled at in obscenities. The manager handled it but we lacked a good night sleep. Not worth the stay nor would we do it again. We learned a few extra dollars will be well worth it to stay at the best western or Hilton. If your looking for cheap go for it. i wouldn't spend a dime there again.

Summary Heading: A little on the dumpy side!
Summary: Ever stayed at a place where the maintenence guy just wasn't very good at maintenence? Painted trim without masking tape, loose shower and sink drains, bent window screen, hard bed, and just an overall run down look and feel. No air conditioning, just a couple of table fans. The price is low and reflects what you are getting. I opted for a little better place up the street for another $50 a night and it was well worth it. The room we had did have a cable box for the TV. Didn't watch much TV though.

I stayed at the Sun 'n' Sands Motel with a girlfriend of mine while we were visiting Huntington Beach. The motel was very clean and the people who worked there were very nice and helpful when it came to answering questions on what we could do while at the beach. We walked down to where all the shops were and had a good time trying on clothes and we ate lunch at Duke's. We also got new piercings at Tommy T's. They were doing so many piercings it was crazy. I guess everyone wants a new piercing when they are on vacation. We went back to the motel to hang out and ended staying up all night. We want to go back as soon as we can and we will stay at the Sun 'n' Sands again. It was really a nice place to stay.

Just got back from a nine night stay at the sun n' sands, and I can't wait to go back again. Our family enjoyed our stay in Huntington immensely. Thank you Carrie and staff for making our stay so enjoyable. The location could not be beat, we surfed and boogie boarded everyday. What a wonderful vacation.

We stayed at the Sun 'n Sands hotel in Huntington Beach, Calif. recently and I must say, it was the most friendly, reasonable, clean place in the area. The location is across from the huge Huntington beach and walkable to central cafes, shops, surf shopping and famous pier area for surfer watching. Thanks to S 'n S for a great couple of beach days, and supplying us with boogie boards was an added bonus!  Born to Surf (from Canada)

Stayed here for one night at the end of August. Paid $175 per room, was VERY disappointed. No air con, two fans in the room which made it noisy trying to sleep. Lot of noise around the property also. Beds were very clean, cable was excellent, but bathroom was VERY tired and hinges to doors and showers rusty, towels old and a bit tattered. A Best western or somewhere like that would NOT put you in rooms like this. I travel a lot and I'm really not hard to please but this was overpriced by at least 100%. I was very surprised given the previous reviews.

Just got back from four nights at the Sun N Sands. It is a great place for families and we were so pleased that the room could hold all six of us. There is one suite that has a king size bed, hide a bed and bunk beds! The kids thought the bunk beds were great! Just across the street from the beach and a close walk to the main street and all of the shops. Saved us from paying for parking at the beach. The staff was so extremely helpful and friendly. We asked about a car show and she didn't know for sure but made some phone calls and got right back to us. This isn't the Ritz Carlton but our family would much rather stay in a good old fashioned place like this. The only suggestion would be that the owner replace the towels with some new ones, the old ones are pretty thin. Although

Summary Heading: a great place for the money!
Summary: sun n sand hotel was a great place to stay with a great view of ocean just across the street.hotel is very clean and quiet very safe and close to every thing ,rooms are nice and clean ,nice pool with ocean view ,main street and peir is just five blocks away 10 min. walk all clubs and night is there and shopping, staff at hotel are very professional and treat you very well Carrie the manager was very helpful and very down to earth she grew up in huntington beach so she knows all the places and hot spots to visit and driving directions she even booked my rental car and had it dropped off at the hotel fresh coffee and donuts in the morning for the beautiful sun rise and chatting in the office with Carrie to plan some fun for the day ...so in short give this hotel a chance you will

Went here for my daughter's spring break. I jumped at a chance to stay near the beach.  The price that they were offering was unbeatable.  I paid that price back in the 80's to stay at Dana Inn, San Diego and that wasn't even close to the beach. We had a great time.  The beach was just across the street.  Each day we spent some time at the beach.  We even came back from Disneyland just to enjoy the beach. Best value, Thanks Sun n Sands staff.

After unknowingly booking a room at a wretched hotel (Pacific View Inn and Suites), I drove as fast away as I could and found Sun n Sands...The night manager was extremely kind and understanding to my plight, in fact offering me the key to view the room before I purchased and putting me in a room "that was suitable for a lady" as she stated.  The cable service on the television was more that I expected. The heater was fabulous and so quiet I wondered if it was working until it began getting toasty! The grounds were quiet and I felt secure.  The beds could really use a pillow top and the bathroom sink could use new faucets that do not spray crazy, but I chalked that up to this being a small cozy hotel and not a chain that will be perfect. There is a definite charm there.

I stayed here for 4 nights in Jan '06. Firstly, i will say that the location is excellent. The motel is literally over the road from the beach and i could see the Ocean from my room, add to this that it was only a 5-10 minute walk to the main street and its fair to say the location is excellent. The downsides were that the room was very small and it definitely was in need of a bit of fresh paint and the bedside lamps could do with being screwed slightly tighter into the wall. Also, most of the cable channels were blocked out and my door had what looked like a fist mark in it.  The first night was $89 as it was a Saturday but then the rate dropped down to $69 (all excl. tax), i felt this was a little high for what i got. I would probably try the Best Western down the road next

We wanted a small, older hotel with personality (we hate chain hotels) and really loved Sun and Sands.  The room was small, efficient and well-priced. A couple minutes walk across the street to the beach, ten minutes to the pier and downtown Huntington Beach. Carrie (sp?), the manager, was very nice and answered all our questions.  They even have boogie boards for use by guests.  There is nothing fancy about this hotel, but they provided a nice television, microwave and refrigerator in the room -- as well as clean beds.

Stayed in the largest room with kitchen/diner and a fantastic ocean view.  Very warm welcome from the owner, who had lots of info about places to go nearby. Good value for money, very short walk from the centre of town, would stay there again.

I set up a large group of my friends in this hotel.  The first night I killed 6 roaches in my room.  When I complained I was moved to a nicer room.  The owner then made me pay $22 extra a night for said nicer room.

Sun N Sands is really close to everything you want to do in Huntington Beach..Its just minutes from the pier and downtown Huntington Beach for a really good price. I moved from another hotel that was in the city of Huntington Beach but was about 10 miles away from the pier/downtown and they accomidated me very quickly at Sun N Sands.
